issue.title: Forward given filter block to matcher

repository.name: capybara
repository.description: Acceptance test framework for web applications

body: @cbliard just to be clear, the problem you're seeing is that the behavior is different due to Ruby's block precedence rules, and you'd like the behavior to be the same?
Is there anything I can do to help and get this issue and the associated PR reviewed?

The fact the blocks aren't getting evaluated is down to ruby binding precedence, and I'm guessing `rubocop` would have warned of such and suggested putting ()s around things to make unambiguous.  Due to that I'm closing this issue as not really a Capybara issue.  The change in https://github.com/teamcapybara/capybara/pull/2617/files is being considered but currently the tests added are not acceptable as implemented.

issue.title: Update integration specs

repository.name: alaveteli
repository.description: Provide a Freedom of Information request system for your jurisdiction

issue.body:
## Relevant issue(s)

Needed for #7674 

## What does this do?

Update integration specs

## Why was this needed?

These specs are either outdated with our current implementation or just broken but the errors are hidden due to an issue upstream in Capybara.

## Implementation notes

Depending on the block notation used Capybara will return different results:
```
# will fail
expect(page).to have_selector("input") { false }

# will pass
expect(page).to have_selector("input") do
  false
end
```

This has been fixed in Capybara v3.39.0

See: https://github.com/teamcapybara/capybara/issues/2616

issue.title: Use updated capybara filter_block syntax

repository.name: blacklight
repository.description: Blacklight provides a discovery interface for any Solr (http://lucene.apache.org/solr) index.

issue.body:
https://github.com/teamcapybara/capybara/issues/2616 changed how blocks are evaluated.  Thanks to @maxkadel for finding this change!

Also includes a fix for https://github.com/ViewComponent/view_component/pull/1666

closes #3043

issue.title: [#64235] Provide A11y labels for pagination links

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update Javascript code

repository.name: openproject
repository.description: OpenProject is the leading open source project management software.

issue.body:
**This PR is based off #19515. Please review/merge that PR first.** # Ticket https://community.openproject.org/wp/65625 # What are you trying to accomplish? Follow on from #19374 #19333 - porting the ng `table-pagination.component` changes to `PaginationHelper` in the Rails code. This PR also updates the Next, Previous buttons to display a both Octicon and text.
Rails HTML ```html
  • Previous
  • 1
  • 2
  • 3
  • Next
  • (21 - 40/50)
  • Per page:
  • 20
  • 100
```
Angular HTML ```html
  • 1
  • (1 - 20/2761)
  • Per page:
  • 20
```
## Screenshots # What approach did you choose and why? # Merge checklist - [x] Added/updated tests - [ ] Added/updated documentation in Lookbook (patterns, previews, etc) - [ ] Tested major browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, ...)

issue.title: Remove redundant `NoDoEndBlockWithRSpecCapybaraMatcherInExpect` cop

repository.name: rubocop-openproject
repository.description: Cops to be used with OpenProject code

issue.body:
This cop was necessary when using previous versions of Capybara due to teamcapybara/capybara#2616:

> `do .. end` block has less precedence than method call, a `do .. end` block at the end of a rspec matcher will be an argument to the `to` method, which is not handled by Capybara matchers

Capybara 3.39.0 (released 2023-04-02) introduced filter block forwarding to a number of matchers, making this cop redundant.

See: teamcapybara/capybara@cacd032489b443fe5d9580752776d7e34fea4203 (fix commit)
See: teamcapybara/capybara#2617 (fix PR)
See: https://github.com/teamcapybara/capybara/blob/master/History.md#version-3390 (CHANGELOG)
